docs.lead_paragraph: Republicans retained control of the House in this week's election, but because of retirements and party-imposed term limits on committee chairmen, more than half a dozen committees will be getting new chairmen.

headline.main: New Leaders Join Veterans to Head House Committees
headline.print_headline: New Leaders Join Veterans to Head House Committees

docs.snippet: Republicans retained control of the House in this week's election, but because of retirements and party-imposed term limits on committee chairmen, more than half a dozen committees will be getting new chairmen.

docs.lead_paragraph: One new committee chairman favors more U.S. forces in Iraq to counter the growing threat from Islamic State militants. Another has written about global warming as a hoax. A third has the 2010 financial overhaul law in his sights.

headline.main: GOP in Charge, Senate Committees Get New Leaders
headline.print_headline: GOP in Charge, Senate Committees Get New Leaders

docs.snippet: One new committee chairman favors more U.S. forces in Iraq to counter the growing threat from Islamic State militants. Another has written about global warming as a hoax. A third has the 2010 financial overhaul law in his sights.

docs.lead_paragraph: Attorneys for the estate of a disabled toddler who died of malnutrition and dehydration and his six siblings are suing county agencies and health care providers in northern Ohio, claiming they ignored warning signs of neglect.

headline.main: Lawsuit Filed on Behalf of Siblings of Starved Boy
headline.print_headline: Lawsuit Filed on Behalf of Siblings of Starved Boy

docs.snippet: Attorneys for the estate of a disabled toddler who died of malnutrition and dehydration and his six siblings are suing county agencies and health care providers in northern Ohio, claiming they ignored warning signs of neglect.

docs.lead_paragraph: The number of potential successors for the top spot at PepsiCo is thinning as yet another highly regarded executive announced his departure.

headline.main: Another Potential Pepsi CEO Successor Departs
headline.print_headline: Another Potential Pepsi CEO Successor Departs

docs.snippet: The number of potential successors for the top spot at PepsiCo is thinning as yet another highly regarded executive announced his departure.

docs.lead_paragraph: The change in policy comes after the department last year approved the export of chicken raised in the United States to be processed in China.

headline.main: U.S.D.A. to Allow Chicken From Chinese Companies
headline.print_headline: U.S.D.A. to Allow Chicken From Chinese Companies

docs.abstract: Agriculture Dept will allow Chinese poultry processing companies to ship fully cooked, frozen and refrigerated chicken to United States; change in policy follows one year after department approved export of chicken raised in the United States to be processed in China.
docs.snippet: The change in policy comes after the department last year approved the export of chicken raised in the United States to be processed in China.

docs.lead_paragraph: New Haven Farms, in the Fair Haven section of the Connecticut city, is a combination of community garden, cooking school and weight-loss program.

headline.main: What the Doctor Ordered: Urban Farming
headline.print_headline: What the Doctor Ordered: Urban Farming

docs.abstract: New Haven Farms, made up of seven community gardens in Fair Haven neighborhood of this Connecticut city, allows residents to grow and harvest their own crops; about 25 private and public organizations support New Haven Farms, which also offers communal dinners and lectures on nutritious eating and cooking.
docs.snippet: New Haven Farms, in the Fair Haven section of the Connecticut city, is a combination of community garden, cooking school and weight-loss program.

docs.lead_paragraph: A new study of infant monkeys demonstrates that a hormone present in a mother’s milk can have profound effects on how her offspring develops.

headline.main: In a Mother’s Milk, Nutrients, and a Message, Too

docs.snippet: A new study of infant monkeys demonstrates that a hormone present in a mother’s milk can have profound effects on how her offspring develops.

docs.lead_paragraph: Food and biotech companies spent $60 million battling proposals dealing with what Americans can and cannot eat and drink.

headline.main: Election Day Entailed Casting Votes for Soda Taxes and Food Issues Too
headline.print_headline: Election Day Entailed Casting Votes for Soda Taxes and Food Issues Too

docs.abstract: Voters across the country delivered mixed messages on number of measures and initiatives involving food and beverages; food and biotech companies spent at least $60 million fighting proposals linked to what Americans eat and drink, and considerable amount of media attention was devoted to food issues in midterm elections.
docs.snippet: Food and biotech companies spent $60 million battling proposals dealing with what Americans can and cannot eat and drink.

docs.lead_paragraph: Tips for ladies who regret their sharply shorn pixie cuts as they endure the slow process back to longer hair.
docs.abstract: Many women who flocked to get trendy pixie haircuts are regretting decision; stylists offer advice for growing short hair back out.
docs.snippet: Tips for ladies who regret their sharply shorn pixie cuts as they endure the slow process back to longer hair.

docs.lead_paragraph: Herbalife Ltd would pay $15 million to settle an 18-month battle over a class action lawsuit brought by a former distributor claiming that the nutrition and supplements company is running an alleged pyramid scheme, according to a U.S. court filing.

headline.main: Herbalife to Pay $15 Million to Settle Class Action Lawsuit
headline.print_headline: Herbalife to Pay $15 Million to Settle Class Action Lawsuit

docs.snippet: Herbalife Ltd would pay $15 million to settle an 18-month battle over a class action lawsuit brought by a former distributor claiming that the nutrition and supplements company is running an alleged pyramid scheme, according to a U.S. court filing.
